name: Prospective Residential CCHP (FS)

market_entry_year_source.notes: Program target year for the technology performance level indicated by this ECM, updated to current year to avoid retroactive savings effects.

source_data.title: Building Technologies Office Multi-Year Program Plan

energy_efficiency_source.notes: Convert primary heating COP of 1.07 (Table 3) to site COP, multiply by 3.01; assume target cooling COP (unavailable) is double that of heating

source_data.title: Building Technologies Office Multi-Year Program Plan

installed_cost_source.notes: $25/kBtu/h cost premium (Table 3 in BTO MYPP) relative to best in market residential air source heat pump (see notes below Table 3 in BTO MYPP) + baseline cost of $169.4/kBtu/h ($6100 total installed cost / 36 kBtu/h typical capacity, from EIA data for 2020 'typical' residential air source heat pumps) * 36 kBtu/h typical capacity per unit (from EIA data)

source_data.title: Updated Buildings Sector Appliance and Equipment Costs and Efficiencies
Building Technologies Office Multi-Year Program Plan

product_lifetime_source.notes: Median of average lifetimes for 2020 'typical' residential air source heat pump

source_data.title: Updated Buildings Sector Appliance and Equipment Costs and Efficiencies

market_scaling_fractions_source.heating: Applies to all residential fuel-fired heating; no electric heating is switched by this ECM

cooling.title: RECS 2015 Microdata
cooling.fraction_derivation: Cooling multiple of 59.5% was determined as a proportion of total homes with a ducted cooling system where heating is done using any non-electric heating energy source. Total homes with ducted cooling in the sample is 76,090,522, and then filtered for homes with fuel-fired heating system (45,241,958).

_description: Air source heat pump for application in residential buildings in colder climates
